Key Match Events: Josh Little dismissed the two English openers Jos Buttler (0) and Alex Hales (7) in space of nine balls.
Fionn Hand knocked over the dangerous Ben Stokes with a back of length delivery that sharply cut back in the last over of Power Play.
Barry McCarthy induced a top edge of Dawid Malan inside 14 overs as they still needed 72 runs form 41 balls.
Liam Livingstone and Mark Wood snared three wickets apiece to turn it around for England and bowl out Ireland for 157.
Andy Balbirnie smashed a 47-ball 62, his eighth T20 half ton, his first in a T20 World Cup, in an entertaining 82-run second wicket partnership with Lorcan Tucker (34).
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland's 100 came up in just 68 balls before a freak run-out brought an end to Tucker's fine innings.
Others: This was Ireland's maiden win in the second stage of the T20 World Cup.
Ireland's win has now opened the doors for Australia as five of the six teams in the group now have two points each.
